course_description: History of recreation and leisure movement; theories and philosophies of play, recreation and leisure. Developmental stages of leisure services to contemporary status.

course_name: Academic Planning and Career Orientation in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Orientation to the field and analysis of career opportunities in leisure services. Academic planning leading to B.S. in parks, recreation and tourism.Graded on S/U basis only.

This course will examine the meaning of sport management in terms of its history, scope, principles, issues and future trends.  In addition, this course examines the job responsibilities and competencies required of sport managers in a variety of sport organizations. Graded on A-F basis only.

This course will investigate the functions of management in terms of design, implementation, operating and financing public assembly facilities in order to help sell the sport product.  Venues such as public and private arenas, coliseums and stadiums will be studied. Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: May be restricted to Parks, Recreation, and Tourism majorsCorequisites: P_R_TR 2082,  P_R_TR 2083

course_description: This course provides introductory instruction and hands-on shooting with an introduction to shooting range management. Graded on A-F basis only.

This course is offered to introduce students to Sport Management by discussing the variety of sports, issues, perspectives and people that make the daily sport page worth reading.  Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1080Corequisites: Instructor consent required if P_R_TR 1080 is taken concurrently

course_name: Research and Descriptive Statistics for Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: An introduction to research methods and techniques and descriptive statistics and their application in the field of recreation and park administration. Math Reasoning Proficiency Course.

This course will provide an overview of organization and management of domestic and international sport, including the Olympic movement and examination of the globalization of U.S. professional sports.  The course will also look into facility design and technology used in sports environment.  Graded on A-F basis only.

This course will provide an overview of organization and management of domestic and international sport, including the Olympic movement and examination of the globalization of U.S. profession sports. Graded on A-F basis only.

This course will teach students how to solve sports technology problems they will face in their future career, plus develop computer aided design and manufacturing skills.  They will also gain skills in team work, communication and presentation, IT, research and project management. Graded on A-F basis only.

course_name: Topics in Park, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Specialized topic content in parks, recreation and tourism programs, management and/or development. Subject content and credit may vary by semester based on faculty resources and student needs. Offered periodically.

course_name: Topics in Park, Recreation and Tourism - Writing Intensive
course_description: Specialized topic content in parks, recreation and tourism programs, management and/or development. Subject content and credit may vary by semester based on faculty resources and student needs. Offered periodically.

course_name: Topics in Park, Recreation and Tourism - Behavioral Science
course_description: Specialized topic content in parks, recreation and tourism programs, management and/or development. Subject content and credit may vary by semester based on faculty resources and student needs. Offered periodically.

course_name: Topics in Park, Recreation and Tourism - Social Science
course_description: Specialized topic content in parks, recreation and tourism programs, management and/or development. Subject content and credit may vary by semester based on faculty resources and student needs. Offered periodically.
A scientific perspective on water chemistry, preventive maintenance of aquatic facilities with an emphasis on the newest safety and engineering design information and construction techniques.

course_name: Introduction to Planning and Evaluating Leisure Environments
course_description: Presentation of basic planning principles. Evaluation of existing areas and facilities based upon planning guidelines. Consideration of park plans, standards, terminology, map preparation and evaluation.
An organized undergraduate experiential learning opportunity.

Organization and administration of camps; program planning; selection and training of staff; camp site selection and development; health and safety; camp history, standards, trends; practical application of camp craft skills.
Study and practice in techniques of leading social activities suitable for various social settings. Offered periodically.

course_name: Organization and Conduct of Recreation Centers
course_description: Problems of operation, management of playgrounds, recreation centers.

course_name: Ethics and Current Issues in Sports
course_description: Ethical strategies of sport management will be emphasized in all management decisions and current issues that today's sport business professional faces will be studied.  Graded on A-F basis only.
An introduction to public recreation in local government.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1010, P_R_TR 1011, P_R_TR 2111 or instructor's consent

course_description: This course focuses on the business side of sport management, considering issues of marketing, sponsorship, and sales.  Students will also be presented with actual models relevant to working in sales in the competitive sport environment.   Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: some sections may be restricted to Parks, Recreation, and Tourism majors with Sport Management emphasis or instructor consent

course_name: Private and Commercial Recreation Principles and Practice
course_description: Considers principles, practices, influences in public/ private leisure services; influence of tourism/travel on public/private recreation services.
This course is designed as an independent study for students to gain professional experience. Graded on A-F basis only.

An overview of social research methods, including terms, human and scientific inquiry, ethical behavior, literature review, sampling questionnaire construction, types of data collection, statistical analysis, and reporting of results.  Graded on A-F basis only.

This course focuses on the economic and financial issues within the sport industry.  The class will help students understand basic and complex concepts within economics and finance in a sport context, and to grasp the importance of financial and economic decision making.  Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; Restricted to Parks, Recreation, and Tourism majors with Sport Management emphasis or instructor consent

course_description: This course focuses on the economic and financial issues within the sport industry.  The class will help students understand basic and complex concepts within economics and finance in a sport context, and to grasp the importance of financial and economic decision making.  Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; Restricted to Parks, Recreation, and Tourism majors with Sport Management emphasis or instructor consent.  Honors eligibility required

course_name: Pre-Internship Seminar in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: The course is designed to prepare students for P_R_TR 4940. Emphasis is placed on students' responsibilities prior to enrollment in P_R_TR 4940, selecting internship sites and completing internship requirements.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; restricted to Parks, Recreation and Tourism students only

course_name: Personnel Management and Leadership in Leisure Services
course_description: Considers theories and practices of leadership and management in leisure services employment. Topic presentation in relationships, attitudes, supervision, motivation and group functioning.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; restricted to Parks, Recreation and Tourism majors

course_name: Personnel Management and Leadership in Leisure Services - Writing Intensive
course_description: Considers theories and practices of leadership and management in leisure services employment. Topic presentation in relationships, attitudes, supervision, motivation and group functioning.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; restricted to Parks, Recreation and Tourism majors

course_description: Fundamental principles and techniques of program development; seasonal, year round, specialty areas and total agency program planning.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011, or instructor's consent; restricted to Parks, Recreation and Tourism majors

course_name: Introduction to Recreation for Individuals with Disabilities
course_description: Principles, concepts and historical development of recreation for individuals with disabilities. Explanation of attitudes, issues, practice and barriers related to recreation participation.  Graded on A-F basis only.

An investigation of therapeutic recreation service delivery models of the P_R_TR 2111 and disabled in both institutional and community settings. Particular emphasis will be placed on advanced leadership and therapeutic interactional skills and dynamics.

course_name: Introduction to Parks and Outdoor Recreation Services
course_description: An overview of parks and outdoor recreation, natural environment, supply-demand-need relationships, interpretative programming, management philosophies/practices will be studied.

course_name: Introduction to Parks and Outdoor Recreation Services - Writing Intensive
course_description: An overview of parks and outdoor recreation, natural environment, supply-demand-need relationships, interpretative programming, management philosophies/practices will be studied.
Interpretive principles and techniques employed to communicate values, natural history and cultural features to the recreation user.

course_name: Governance and Policy in Sport and Leisure
course_description: This course serves as a comprehensive study in examining how leisure organizations address fundamental issues of governance and policy.  Through careful use of policy and understanding of governance, organizations often form strategies in their attempts to gain an advantage. Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; Restricted to Parks, Recreation, and Tourism majors with Sport Management emphasis

course_description: (cross-leveled with P_R_TR 7208). Theoretical foundations of the organization and administration of leisure services in both community and institutional settings. Emphasis on the roles of the administrator.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; Restricted to Parks, Recreation and Tourism majors

course_description: Practical application of basic planning principles and design. Layout and design of various leisure-oriented areas and facilities. Site planning and analysis.
Presentation of professional principles and issues in leisure services. Seminar study resulting in presentations and discussions.

course_name: Operation of Therapeutic Recreation: Procedures and Principles
course_description: Theories and principles of leadership and programming as they apply to recreation services for the ill, handicapped, and aged.

Basic understanding of problems/needs of later maturity in relation to recreation. Characteristics/capabilities of aged, program settings, financial support, planning guidelines emphasized. Objectives: provide fundamentals for recreation planning with aged individuals/groups. Offered periodically.
Techniques and models of leisure facilitation for use within a variety of clinical, residential and Institutional models. Theories of positive/negative leisure engagement reviewed.

Reviews accepted clinical protocols for determining a client's physical, emotional, social and cognitive levels of functioning. Competencies in administering, scoring and interpreting multiple tools included.

course_name: Administration of Outdoor Recreation - Education Programs
course_description: (cross-leveled with P_R_TR 7331). Philosophies, essential principles, methods, techniques, resources, administrative and program practices for outdoor recreation and education. Offered periodically.
Basic principles, practices and problems involved in managing public park systems. Consideration given to local, district, county, state, federal and foreign park systems.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; Restricted to Parks, Recreation and Tourism majors

course_description: (cross-leveled with P_R_TR 7340).  Advanced study of problems facing forest recreation managers. Topics include rivers recreation, wilderness management and citizen participation in decision making. Offered periodically.

course_name: Problems in Parks, Recreation and Tourism

course_description: Introduction to the scope and scale of the tourism industry. Focus on the industry components, concepts, structures, relationships, and issues with regard to accommodation, transportation, travel, regional development, political system, and the economic, social and environmental effects of tourism.

Nature and scope of tourism planning at the local, regional, and national levels; economic social, environmental, and policy considerations. Comparative study of initiating, planning and implementing tourism and the organization of community resources for developing and controlling a tourism industry.

This course studies the U. S. legal system, its structure and terminology.  Legal aspects of contract law, statutory law, constitutional law, intellectual property, torts, negligence, and risk management in sport will be examined.  Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011; Restricted to Parks, Recreation, and Tourism majors with Sports Management emphasis or instructor consent

course_description: Supervised professional experience with an approved organization. Course entails weekly reports, case studies, agency evaluations and a special project related to the student's curricular emphasis.  Graded on A-F basis only.
prerequisites: P_R_TR 1011 and P_R_TR 3189,  P_R_TR majors only, instructor's consent

course_description: This course provides students an educational opportunity to explore Western Canada.  Students analyze natural resource management, customer and visitor relations, community relations, cultural entrepreneurship, and transportation networks with US and Canadian Management methods.

course_name: Independent Research in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Independent research project in parks, recreation and tourism.  Graded on A-F basis only.

(cross-leveled with P_R_TR 4208). Theoretical foundations of the organization and administration of leisure services in both community and institutional settings. Emphasis on the roles of the administrator.
Practical application of basic planning principles and design. Layout and design of various leisure-oriented areas and facilities. Site planning and analysis.

Basic understanding of problems/needs of later maturity in relation to recreation. Characteristics/capabilities of aged, program settings, financial support, planning guidelines emphasized. Objectives: provide fundamentals for recreation planning with aged individuals/groups. Offered periodically. .

course_name: Administration of Outdoor Recreation - Education Programs
course_description: (cross-leveled with P_R_TR 4331). Philosophies, essential principles, methods, techniques, resources, administrative and program practices for outdoor recreation and education. Offered periodically.
Basic principles, practices and problems involved in managing public park systems. Consideration given to local, district, county, state, federal and foreign park systems.

(cross-leveled with P_R_TR 4340). Advanced study of problems facing forest recreation managers. Topics include rivers recreation, wilderness management and citizen participation in decision making. Offered periodically.

course_name: Private and Commercial Recreation Principles and Practice
course_description: Considers principles, practices, influences in public/ private leisure services; influence of tourism/travel on public/private recreation services.

Introduction to the scope and scale of the tourism industry. Focus on the industry components, concepts, structures, relationships, and issues with regard to accommodation, transportation, travel, regional development, political system, and the economic, social and environmental effects of tourism.

Nature and scope of tourism planning at the local, regional, and national levels; economic social, environmental, and policy considerations. Comparative study of initiating, planning and implementing tourism and the organization of community resources for developing and controlling a tourism industry.

course_name: Guided Reading in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Selected reading in parks, recreation and tourism identified to fulfill a graduate student's academic needs or specialized interests.

This course focuses on the business side of sport management, primarily considering issues of marketing, sponsorship, and sales. In this, students will not only supplement knowledge of these concepts, but also be presented with actual models relevant to working in sales in the competitive sport environment. Graded on A-F basis only.

course_name: Problems in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Independent research on special projects.

course_name: Masters Level Graduate Seminar in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: In this course, students and faculty will discuss and critically analyze contemporary issues on social concerns relating to leisure services.  Graded on S/U basis only.

This course focuses on the business side of sport management, primarily considering issues of marketing, sponsorship, and sales. In this, students will not only supplement knowledge of these concepts, but also be presented with actual models relevant to working in sales in the competitive sport environment. Graded on A-F basis only.
Individual research on approved project. Involves creativity and scholarly inquiry where product does not adhere to the traditional thesis format. Graded on S/U basis only.
prerequisites: Parks, Recreation and Tourism graduate major

course_name: Thesis Research in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Research leading to thesis in field of parks, recreation and tourism. Graded on S/U basis only.
prerequisites: Parks, Recreation and Tourism graduate major

course_description: Review analysis and implications of fundamental psycho-social determinants of leisure behavior. Application theories of determinants to existing and proposed leisure service systems.

course_name: Topics in Recreation and Park Administration
course_description: Specialized topics in recreation and park administration dynamics. Subjects and credits vary by semester based on available faculty resources and expertise. Course content announced in advance.

course_name: Independent Work in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Independent research or special projects in parks, recreation and tourism.
Study of the developmental patterns of leisure services in society with emphasis to the dynamics of technology and leisure on individual and social values.

The course will include new issues and ideas in the field of therapeutic recreation, such as registration, insurance, liability, licensure, assessment, etc., and how they relate to practitioners and services to clients.

course_name: Research Methods in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Analysis of basic research methodology. Review and analysis of research work completed in recreation, park and leisure field.

Course presents issues, concerns and policies dealing with multi-management/planning/operations of outdoor resource based recreation. Such issues as energy, economics, social/ political, pollution and user characteristics will be studied.
Study of the theoretical and philosophical perspective of leisure in society with emphasis on integration and development of the student's personal and professional viewpoint.
Review, analysis and synthesis of administrative functions as related to public and private recreation and leisure service enterprises.

course_name: Financial Operations in Leisure Service Delivery
course_description: Review and critical analysis of financial functions, strategies and methodology as related to public and private recreation and leisure service enterprises.

course_name: Internship in Parks, Recreation and Tourism
course_description: Supervised student practice in recreation, park or related settings under qualified instructor.
prerequisites: Parks, Recreation and Tourism graduate major
